intro: Brassica rapa var. orientalis, commonly known as the Chinese kale or kale, is a leafy vegetable that belongs to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its thick, dark green leaves that are often curled or crinkled. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and produces small yellow flowers in the spring. Its roots are also edible and can be used in various culinary preparations. This variety is well adapted to temperate climates and is widely cultivated for its nutritional value and versatility in cooking.
